description: [Ethiopian Herald] The questions of fairness and inclusiveness are among the priorities that Africans and the Global South have continuously been asking major organizations of the world.
title: Africa: Africa, Ethiopia - Efforts Towards UNSC Reform

description: [UCT] Therapeutic drugs have long been ill suited to African patients' needs. Professor Kelly Chibale, the director of the University of Cape Town's (UCT) Holistic Drug Discovery and Development Centre (H3D), and his research colleagues posit that scientists can use artificial intelligence (AI) to change this.
title: Africa: Using AI to Tailor Drugs for Africa

description: [ICRC] When someone goes missing due to conflict, the children they leave behind can feel that loss more than most. In response, we ran a program for children in Maiduguri to make sure their needs would not be overlooked.
title: Africa: Keeping the Dreams Alive - Supporting Children in Northeast Nigeria
Africa: A Chance for Africa to Counter the Pitfalls of International Criminal Justice?

description: [DW] El Nino is causing extreme weather events in East Africa and a crippling drought in the south of the continent. Experts say immediate action is needed to tackle famine and displacement.
title: Africa: Africa's El Nino Crises Demand Action and Funding

description: [WWF] As negotiators head into the fourth and penultimate UN talks on a global plastic pollution treaty, known as INC-4, a WWF analysis of states' submissions to the treaty's revised draft text shows that the majority of states support ambitious and legally-binding global rules across the plastics lifecycle (see Figure 1 in Notes to Editors).
title: Africa: UN Talks Determine Fate of Global Plastic Pollution Treaty

description: [IPS] APEX / DUBLIN -- With current UN Secretary-General António Guterres set to step down in 2026, who is in the running to replace him? In this seven-part series, Felix Dodds and Chris Spence reveal who might be in the running and assess their chances. The potential candidates include Amina J. Mohammed (Nigeria), Mia Motley (Barbados), Alicia Barcena (Mexico), Maria Fernanda Espinosa (Ecuador), Rebeca Grynspan (Costa Rica) and Michelle Bachelet (Chile). These are names that have come up in conversations with UN
title: Africa: Who Should be the Next UN Leader? - PART 4

description: [IPS] APEX / DUBLIN -- With current UN Secretary-General António Guterres set to step down in 2026, who is in the running to replace him? In this seven-part series, Felix Dodds and Chris Spence reveal who might be in the running and assess their chances. The potential candidates include Amina J. Mohammed (Nigeria), Mia Motley (Barbados), Alicia Barcena (Mexico), Maria Fernanda Espinosa (Ecuador), Rebeca Grynspan (Costa Rica) and Michelle Bachelet (Chile). These are names that have come up in conversations with UN
title: Africa: Who Should be the Next UN Leader? - PART 4

description: [IPS] Apex, North Carolina / Dublin, Ireland -- This was the stark warning of Rebeca Grynspan, Secretary-General of the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), in 2023.
title: Africa: Who Should Lead the United Nations? - Part 5

description: [Daily Trust] InfraCo Africa, part of the Private Infrastructure Development Group (PIDG), has signed an agreement with Savant Group Ltd, committing US$12 million to scale SunCulture's solar irrigation offering across sub-Saharan Africa, according to a report by Fresh Plaza.
title: Africa: Solar Irrigation Offering to Be Rolled Out Across Sub-Saharan Africa

description: [allAfrica] Dar es Salaam, Tanzania -- "Did you know hundreds of thousands of women die in childbirth every year? Dr Anita Zaidi is determined to change that."
title: Africa: Can We Achieve the Global Target for Maternal Mortality?

description: [IPS] Apex, North Carolina / Dublin, Ireland -- Michelle Bachelet is a formidable candidate to be the next UN Secretary-General. Some would even make her the frontrunner, should she choose to stand. Bachelet was the first female head of state in Chile, having served as president on two separate occasions: 2006 to 2010, and 2014 to 2018. Bachelet can also boast a long pedigree when it comes to human rights.
title: Africa: Who Should Be the Next UN Leader? - Part 6

description: [VOA] Monday marks Earth Day, which for more than 50 years has placed a focus on clean air and water, addressing pollution and championing conservation efforts.
title: Africa: Earth Day Puts Focus on Conservation Efforts

description: [UNEP] It is easy to get discouraged by the state of the planet.
title: Africa: Five Ways You Can Help Save the Environment this Mother Earth Day

description: [Africa Renewal] Integrity is key as world's largest carbon market auction is held in Nairobi
title: Africa: Creating Credible Carbon Market in Africa

description: [COP28 UAR] COP28  President Dr.  Sultan Al Jaber  was recognized with an award by the World Energy Council for his leadership in advancing the energy transition through the delivery of the historic UAE Consensus.
title: Africa: COP28 President Wins Award for Energy Leadership

description: [Unicef] New York/Oslo -- Between 2018 and 2022, explosive weapons were responsible for nearly half - 49.8 per cent - of the more than 47,500 instances of children killed and maimed that were verified by the United Nations, in more than 24 conflict zones globally. The vast majority of these instances occurred in populated areas.
title: Africa: Meaningful Action to Prevent the Use of Explosive Weapons in Populated Areas Could Almost Halve Number of Child Casualties in Conflicts

description: [African Arguments] A decade ago, Europe responded to Rwanda's incursions into the DRC with sanctions. Today, it's turning a blind eye - with devastating consequences for the Congolese.
title: Africa: Europe's Indifference to Rwanda's Atrocities Is Costing Congolese Lives

description: [African Arguments] Funding these essential meetings would cost little to rich countries but provide a potentially invaluable forum for developing countries.
title: Africa: Calling Off UN Regional Climate Weeks Exposes Rich Nations' Lack of Goodwill
